content.webTitle: Tiscali plans to buy Home Choice TV owner

fields.headline: Tiscali plans to buy Home Choice TV owner
fields.bodyText: Internet service provider Tiscali admitted yesterday that it is looking to merge its UK business with Video Networks, the owner of the Home Choice TV and broadband brand. Video Networks, which has yet to make a profit after more than £250m of investment, is majority-owned by Chris Larson, a Microsoft founder. The company had been looking to raise more cash to expand its service beyond London and Stevenage, where it has 45,000 customers, but instead looked for a sale with a price tag of £100m. Tiscali said it would shortly inform the market about the outcome of negotiations.
